heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 26 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (164°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (230.0°) by approximately 66.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 485 m), dew point temperature (down 1.5°C), and inside temperature (up 1.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 633.3m lower than yesterday, 315.0m lower than the past week, 485.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 789m and a peak of 2540m, averaging 838.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and winds will be practically absent. Showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
